Package table

Class Table

java.lang.Object
table.Table
public class Table extends Object
Represents a table containing rows of data associated with a specific user and their contacts. This class allows for operations on the table such as adding, modifying, and deleting contacts, as well as retrieving the user's contacts as rows or persons.
Author:
Leuti Michele

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Table(User u)
    Constructs a table for the specified user without any initial contacts.
    Table(User u, ArrayList<Person> contacts)
    Constructs a table for the specified user, initializing it with a list of contacts.

  • Constructor Details

    • Table

      public Table(User u)
      Constructs a table for the specified user without any initial contacts.
      Parameters:
      u - The user associated with this table.

    • Table

      public Table(User u, ArrayList<Person> contacts)
      Constructs a table for the specified user, initializing it with a list of contacts. Each contact is represented as a row in the table.
      Parameters:
      u - The user associated with this table.
      contacts - A list of Person objects to be added as rows in the table.

  • Method Details

    • getRows

      public ArrayList<Row> getRows()
      Retrieves the list of rows in the table.
      Returns:
      A list of Row objects representing the user's contacts.

    • getPersons

      public ArrayList<Person> getPersons()
      Retrieves a list of Person objects from the rows in the table. This method extracts and returns the contacts as a list of Person objects.
      Returns:
      A list of Person objects representing the contacts in the table.

    • getUser

      public User getUser()
      Retrieves the user associated with this table.
      Returns:
      The User object associated with this table.

    • addContact

      public void addContact(Person p)
      Adds a new contact to the table. This method creates a new row for the specified Person object and adds it to the table.
      Parameters:
      p - The Person object to be added as a new contact.

    • modifyContact

      public void modifyContact(Person p)
      Modifies the information of an existing contact in the table. This method finds the row associated with the specified Person object and updates its information.
      Parameters:
      p - The Person object with updated information.

    • deleteContact

      public void deleteContact(Person p)
      Deletes a contact from the table. This method removes the row associated with the specified Person object from the table.
      Parameters:
      p - The Person object to be removed from the table.

    • selectContacts

      public String[] selectContacts(int[] rowIndexes)
      Selects contacts by their row indexes and returns their IDs. This method is useful for operations that require identifying specific contacts by their position in the table.
      Parameters:
      rowIndexes - An array of integers representing the indexes of the rows to be selected.
      Returns:
      An array of String objects representing the IDs of the selected contacts.

    • modifyUser

      public void modifyUser(User user)
      Updates the user associated with this table. This method allows for changing the user and, implicitly, the context of the table.
      Parameters:
      user - The new User object to be associated with this table.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provides a string representation of the table, formatted for display. This method organizes the table's data into a readable format, listing each contact's information.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the table, including headers and each row's data.
